intro: Curtia, commonly known as the "southern magnolia," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Magnoliaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their large, showy, fragrant flowers and broad, glossy leaves. Curtia species typically grow as evergreen trees or shrubs, often reaching significant heights. They play an important role in their native ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
